page.title: 04Armed Forces Camp
page.content: RAF Greatworth was started in 1943. A signals convoy set up a temporary station on the site. Two huts were later erected on the site and the Air Ministry made RAF Greatworth permanent in 1953. The Detachment based at Greatworth has housing for single airmen and twelve married quarters. There is also an officer's quarter for the Detachment Commander. The children's education takes them to the local primary school and at present there are five children attending school. The Commander of the base allows local clubs to us the Detachment's football pitch. The officers and men of the camp are involved in a great many aspects of village life. Many take responsibilities within the local teams, organisations and clubs.
